title: How to Unlock a Read Only PowerPoint Presentation (in 4 Steps)

steps.title: Open the PowerPoint project.
steps.content: Open the PowerPoint project. You can open PowerPoint from your Start menu or Applications folder, then open the project by going to File > Open . On the other hand, you can also right-click the file in either your file manager or Finder and select Open with > PowerPoint .

steps.title: Click the File tab.
steps.content: Click the File tab. You'll see this in the editing ribbon above the document space with Animations and Home .

steps.title: Click Protect Presentation.
steps.content: Click Protect Presentation . You'll see this with an icon of a lock to the right of the Info menu. A menu will drop down from the lock icon.

steps.title: Click Mark as Final.
steps.content: Click Mark as Final . Clicking here will undo the lock and remove the presentation protection. The "Read-Only" text is gone from the title and the yellow banner will disappear, which means you can edit the PowerPoint. [1] X Research source To return the file to read-only, repeat the process to select "Mark as Final."
